title: Army withdraws troops from Rio favela
description:
(29 Sep 2017) Military troops are pulling out of Rio de Janeiro's largest shanty town after a week to back up police operations against drug traffickers.
Brigadier Ricardo Jose Campos, deputy chief of joint operations, told reporters on Friday that the situation in the Rocinha favela has been "stabilised."
Nearly a thousand troops were sent in a week ago, as shootings erupted in Rocinha and other slums citywide. 
Schools cancelled class and roads were closed, as many feared an escalation in violence.  
The situation is the favela is still tense as the job of patrolling the streets goes back to heavily armed police.
Besides being the city's largest favela, Rocinha also gets much attention from authorities because of its location - next to some of the city's upscale neighbourhoods.
